definition: belonging to or constituting the form or essence of a thing
relating to or involving the outward form, structure, relationships, or arrangement of elements rather than content
examples: a formal approach to comparative linguistics

definition: following or according with established form, custom, or rule
done in due or lawful form
characterized by punctilious respect for form : methodical
examples: very formal in all his dealings
the ambience was overly formal, everyone but me was wearing a suit and tie

definition: having the appearance without the substance
examples: formal Christians who go to church only at Easter

definition: something (such as a dance or a dress) formal in character
